definition: to write a poem on the order of the Emperor
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

sentences.english: The kings and royal governments often promoted the composing of Ci directly by ordering people to do it.
sentences.chinese: 帝王或朝廷往往以命人应制的方式直接推动词的创作。

sentences.english: Fawn court, should the system of multi-word for.
sentences.chinese: 趋奉宫廷，词多应制之作。

sentences.english: The Under-ordered Ci was monotonic and stereotyped in the sense of concrete practice.
sentences.chinese: 应制词在具体技法上显得单调程式化。

sentences.english: The feature of being flowery and delicately composed was the artistic pursuit of all these Ci writers.
sentences.chinese: 富艳精工是历朝应制词人的艺术追求。

sentences.english: The Yingzhi Poem of early-Tang is just the typical representation of this state of affairs.
sentences.chinese: 初唐应制诗就是这一情形的典型代表。

sentences.english: So, according to the specific circumstances of the regular cleaning scale system plan.
sentences.chinese: 所以，根据具体情况应制定期清洗水垢的计划。

definition: verse form consisting of 8 lines of 7 syllables, with rhyme on alternate lines/abbr. to 七律
variant of 諷喻|讽喻[feng3 yu4]
to draft/to draw up/to compose (a plan or document)
old variant of 補缺|补缺[bu3 que1]
to respond to an imperial decree
gratitude for good treatment/to sigh/to lament
